   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(base64_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: %% Test server specific exports
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, group/1]).
   27: 
   28: %% Test cases must be exported.
   29: -export([base64_encode/1, base64_decode/1, base64_otp_5635/1,
   30: 	 base64_otp_6279/1, big/1, illegal/1, mime_decode/1,
   31: 	 mime_decode_to_string/1,
   32: 	 roundtrip_1/1, roundtrip_2/1, roundtrip_3/1, roundtrip_4/1]).
   33: 
   34: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   35: %% Test cases starts here.
   36: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   37: 
   38: suite() ->
   39:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   40:      {timetrap,{minutes,4}}].
   41: 
   42: all() ->
   43:     [base64_encode, base64_decode, base64_otp_5635,
   44:      base64_otp_6279, big, illegal, mime_decode, mime_decode_to_string,
   45:      {group, roundtrip}].
   46: 
   47: groups() ->
   48:     [{roundtrip, [parallel],
   49:       [roundtrip_1, roundtrip_2, roundtrip_3, roundtrip_4]}].
   50: 
   51: group(roundtrip) ->
   52:     %% valgrind needs a lot of time
   53:     [{timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   54: 
   55: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   56: %% Test base64:encode/1.
   57: base64_encode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   58:     %% Two pads
   59:     <<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==">> =
   60: 	base64:encode("Aladdin:open sesame"),
   61:     %% One pad
   62:     <<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ=">> = base64:encode(<<"Hello World">>),
   63:     %% No pad
   64:     "QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft" =
   65: 	base64:encode_to_string("Aladdin:open sesam"),
   66: 
   67:     "MDEyMzQ1Njc4OSFAIzBeJiooKTs6PD4sLiBbXXt9" =
   68: 	base64:encode_to_string(<<"0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}">>),
   69:     ok.
   70: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   71: %% Test base64:decode/1.
   72: base64_decode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   73:     %% Two pads
   74:     <<"Aladdin:open sesame">> =
   75: 	base64:decode("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ=="),
   76:     %% One pad
   77:     <<"Hello World">> = base64:decode(<<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ=">>),
   78:     %% No pad
   79:     <<"Aladdin:open sesam">> =
   80: 	base64:decode("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft"),
   81: 
   82:     Alphabet = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, 255)),
   83:     Alphabet = base64:decode(base64:encode(Alphabet)),
   84: 
   85:     %% Encoded base 64 strings may be divided by non base 64 chars.
   86:     %% In this cases whitespaces.
   87:     "0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}" =
   88: 	base64:decode_to_string(
   89: 	  "MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \niooKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9"),
   90:     "0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}" =
   91: 	base64:decode_to_string(
   92: 	  <<"MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \niooKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9">>),
   93:     ok.
   94: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   95: %% OTP-5635: Some data doesn't pass through base64:decode/1 correctly.
   96: base64_otp_5635(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   97:     <<"===">> = base64:decode(base64:encode("===")),
   98:     ok.
   99: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  100: %% OTP-6279: Make sure illegal characters are rejected when decoding.
  101: base64_otp_6279(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  102:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode("dGVzda==a")),
  103:     ok.
  104: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  105: %% Encode and decode big binaries.
  106: big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  107:     Big = make_big_binary(300000),
  108:     B = base64:encode(Big),
  109:     true = is_binary(B),
  110:     400000 = byte_size(B),
  111:     Big = base64:decode(B),
  112:     Big = base64:mime_decode(B),
  113:     ok.
  114: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  115: %% Make sure illegal characters are rejected when decoding.
  116: illegal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  117:     %% A few samples with different error reasons. Nothing can be
  118:     %% assumed about the reason for the crash.
  119:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode("()")),
  120:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode(<<19:8,20:8,21:8,22:8>>)),
  121:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode([19,20,21,22])),
  122:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode_to_string(<<19:8,20:8,21:8,22:8>>)),
  123:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode_to_string([19,20,21,22])),
  124:     ok.
  125: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  126: %% mime_decode and mime_decode_to_string have different implementations
  127: %% so test both with the same input separately.
  128: %%
  129: %% Test base64:mime_decode/1.
  130: mime_decode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  131:     MimeDecode = fun(In) ->
  132:                          Out = base64:mime_decode(In),
  133:                          Out = base64:mime_decode(binary_to_list(In))
  134:                  end,
  135:     %% Test correct padding
  136:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<"b25l">>),
  137:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"b24=">>),
  138:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw==">>),
  139:     %% Test 1 extra padding
  140:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<"b25l= =">>),
  141:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"b24== =">>),
  142:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw=== =">>),
  143:     %% Test 2 extra padding
  144:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<"b25l===">>),
  145:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"b24====">>),
  146:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw=====">>),
  147:     %% Test misc embedded padding
  148:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<"b2=5l===">>),
  149:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"b=24====">>),
  150:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"b=w=====">>),
  151:     %% Test misc white space and illegals with embedded padding
  152:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<" b~2=\r\n5()l===">>),
  153:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"\tb =2\"¤4=¤=   ==">>),
  154:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"\nb=w=====">>),
  155:     %% Two pads
  156:     <<"Aladdin:open sesame">> =
  157: 	MimeDecode(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvc()GVuIHNlc2FtZQ==">>),
  158:     %% One pad to ignore, followed by more text
  159:     <<"Hello World!!">> = MimeDecode(<<"SGVsb)(G8gV29ybGQ=h IQ= =">>),
  160:     %% No pad
  161:     <<"Aladdin:open sesam">> =
  162: 	MimeDecode(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcG¤\")(VuIHNlc2Ft">>),
  163:     %% Encoded base 64 strings may be divided by non base 64 chars.
  164:     %% In this cases whitespaces.
  165:     <<"0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}">> =
  166: 	MimeDecode(
  167: 	  <<"MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \nio)(oKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9">>),
  168:     %% Zeroes
  169:     <<"012">> = MimeDecode(<<"\000M\000D\000E\000y=\000">>),
  170:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw==\000">>),
  171:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw=\000=">>),
  172:     ok.
  173: 
  174: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  175: 
  176: %% Repeat of mime_decode() tests
  177: 
  178: %% Test base64:mime_decode_to_string/1.
  179: mime_decode_to_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  180:     MimeDecodeToString =
  181:         fun(In) ->
  182:                 Out = base64:mime_decode_to_string(In),
  183:                 Out = base64:mime_decode_to_string(binary_to_list(In))
  184:         end,
  185:     %% Test correct padding
  186:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b25l">>),
  187:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b24=">>),
  188:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw==">>),
  189:     %% Test 1 extra padding
  190:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b25l= =">>),
  191:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b24== =">>),
  192:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw=== =">>),
  193:     %% Test 2 extra padding
  194:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b25l===">>),
  195:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b24====">>),
  196:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw=====">>),
  197:     %% Test misc embedded padding
  198:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b2=5l===">>),
  199:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b=24====">>),
  200:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b=w=====">>),
  201:     %% Test misc white space and illegals with embedded padding
  202:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<" b~2=\r\n5()l===">>),
  203:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"\tb =2\"¤4=¤=   ==">>),
  204:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"\nb=w=====">>),
  205:     %% Two pads
  206:     "Aladdin:open sesame" =
  207: 	MimeDecodeToString(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvc()GVuIHNlc2FtZQ==">>),
  208:     %% One pad to ignore, followed by more text
  209:     "Hello World!!" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"SGVsb)(G8gV29ybGQ=h IQ= =">>),
  210:     %% No pad
  211:     "Aladdin:open sesam" =
  212: 	MimeDecodeToString(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcG¤\")(VuIHNlc2Ft">>),
  213:     %% Encoded base 64 strings may be divided by non base 64 chars.
  214:     %% In this cases whitespaces.
  215:     "0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}" =
  216: 	MimeDecodeToString(
  217: 	  <<"MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \nio)(oKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9">>),
  218:     %% Zeroes
  219:     "012" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"\000M\000D\000E\000y=\000">>),
  220:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw==\000">>),
  221:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw=\000=">>),
  222:     ok.
  223: 
  224: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  225: 
  226: roundtrip_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  227:     do_roundtrip(1).
  228: 
  229: roundtrip_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  230:     do_roundtrip(2).
  231: 
  232: roundtrip_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  233:     do_roundtrip(3).
  234: 
  235: roundtrip_4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  236:     do_roundtrip(4).
  237: 
  238: do_roundtrip(Offset) ->
  239:     Sizes = lists:seq(Offset, 255, 4) ++ lists:seq(2400-6+Offset, 2440, 4),
  240:     do_roundtrip_1(Sizes, []).
  241: 
  242: do_roundtrip_1([NextSize|Sizes], Current) ->
  243:     Len = length(Current),
  244:     io:format("~p", [Len]),
  245:     do_roundtrip_2(Current),
  246:     Next = random_byte_list(NextSize - Len, Current),
  247:     do_roundtrip_1(Sizes, Next);
  248: do_roundtrip_1([], Last) ->
  249:     io:format("~p", [length(Last)]),
  250:     do_roundtrip_2(Last).
  251: 
  252: do_roundtrip_2(List) ->
  253:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
  254:     Base64Bin = base64:encode(List),
  255:     Base64Bin = base64:encode(Bin),
  256:     Base64List = base64:encode_to_string(List),
  257:     Base64Bin = list_to_binary(Base64List),
  258:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64Bin),
  259:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  260:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64Bin),
  261:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  262:     append_roundtrip(8, Bin, List, Base64Bin),
  263:     prepend_roundtrip(8, Bin, List, Base64List),
  264:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip(Bin, List, Base64List).
  265: 
  266: append_roundtrip(0, _, _, _) -> ok;
  267: append_roundtrip(N, Bin, List, Base64Bin0) ->
  268:     Base64Bin = <<Base64Bin0/binary,"\n">>,
  269:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64Bin),
  270:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  271:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64Bin),
  272:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  273: 
  274:     Base64List = binary_to_list(Base64Bin),
  275:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64List),
  276:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64List),
  277:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64List),
  278:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64List),
  279:     append_roundtrip(N-1, Bin, List, Base64Bin).
  280: 
  281: prepend_roundtrip(0, _, _, _) -> ok;
  282: prepend_roundtrip(N, Bin, List, Base64List0) ->
  283:     Base64List = [$\s|Base64List0],
  284:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64List),
  285:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64List),
  286:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64List),
  287:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64List),
  288: 
  289:     Base64Bin = list_to_binary(Base64List),
  290:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64Bin),
  291:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  292:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64Bin),
  293:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  294:     prepend_roundtrip(N-1, Bin, List, Base64List).
  295: 
  296: %% Do an exhaustive test of interleaving whitespace (for short strings).
  297: interleaved_ws_roundtrip(Bin, List, Base64List) when byte_size(Bin) =< 6 ->
  298:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(lists:reverse(Base64List), [], Bin, List);
  299: interleaved_ws_roundtrip(_, _, _) -> ok.
  300: 
  301: interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1([H|T], Tail, Bin, List) ->
  302:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(T, [H|Tail], Bin, List),
  303:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(T, [H,$\s|Tail], Bin, List),
  304:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(T, [H,$\s,$\t|Tail], Bin, List),
  305:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(T, [H,$\n,$\t|Tail], Bin, List);
  306: interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1([], Base64List, Bin, List) ->
  307:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64List),
  308:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64List),
  309:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64List),
  310:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64List),
  311: 
  312:     Base64Bin = list_to_binary(Base64List),
  313:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64Bin),
  314:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  315:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64Bin),
  316:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  317:     ok.
  318: 
  319: random_byte_list(0, Acc) ->
  320:     Acc;
  321: random_byte_list(N, Acc) ->
  322:     random_byte_list(N-1, [rand:uniform(255)|Acc]).
  323: 
  324: make_big_binary(N) ->
  325:     list_to_binary(mbb(N, [])).
  326: 
  327: mbb(N, Acc) when N > 256 ->
  328:     B = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, 255)),
  329:     mbb(N - 256, [B | Acc]);
  330: mbb(N, Acc) ->
  331:     B = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, N-1)),
  332:     lists:reverse(Acc, B).
